channel.title: Ipads Vs. Android Tablets
channel.description:
http://news.cnet.com/8301-13579_3-57592729-37/ipad-5-sooner-mini-retina-later-suppliers-sing-similar-tune/?refresh=1373772638332
I have been trying to do a lot of research on what type of tablet I should purchase for myself for Christmas and I have just about been sold on Ipad. Are there any remaining features on an android tablet which would make me sway the other way?
I believe personally the Microsoft tablets are far out of the question so not even worth mentioning them.
If nobody can make a good argument for an android compared to the Ipad I will be one of the noobs who will be waiting outside for hours for the new Ipad5 when it comes out ( or try to pre-order from best buy if I can : D )

item.title: Ipads Vs. Android Tablets
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:52, topic:524918”][quote author=Niall link=topic=643612.msg4338548#msg4338548 date=1374770643]
… then buy an Android tablet priced around that of an iPad.
[/quote]
This. I hate it when people try and compare their HTC wildfire’s against iPhone’s and such and say they’re shite. If you’re gonna compare two devices make sure they’re at least relatively similar in price.[/quote]

As an owner of a HTC Wildfire…

In all fairness, it was free, several years ago, and was a low end phone even back then.

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:54, topic:524918”][quote author=Java-RSPS-Noob link=topic=643612.msg4338612#msg4338612 date=1374776962]

[quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=643612.msg4338610#msg4338610 date=1374776892]

… then buy an Android tablet priced around that of an iPad.

This. I hate it when people try and compare their HTC wildfire’s against iPhone’s and such and say they’re shite. If you’re gonna compare two devices make sure they’re at least relatively similar in price.
[/quote]that’s not always true though

I mean look at mac’s…sure they are great and all but you could build a duo sli titan monster that could run circles around the same price mac pc
[/quote]Really? I’ve visited the Apple website a few times over the past few years and compared the price of an iMac with an equivalent build-your-own PC. It’s always worked out at roughly the same price, give or take up to £100. When you factor in stuff like a decent screen, webcam, OS, wireless mouse and keyboard, and so on… it racks the price up quite a bit.[/quote]

Apple’s Desktop range has never been cheaper than custom PC hardware, to the point where an equivalent priced PC rig would annihilate the Apple.

iMac’s change that, Apple are one of the few companies pushing out decent screens with decent resolution and size. If you want a serious competitor for Apple IPS screens you have to go with Dell, which priced alone are fairly expensive.

It’s the same for laptops, you buy them for the screen and form, in every other aspect custom PC hardware or PC laptops win and they mop the floor with Apple.

xx matty xx:

And if you’re a student you get a reduction along with phr33 AppleCare. But obviously if you don’t want any of that shit, or if you want to customise, or if you just hate mac then clearly PC build is the way to go.

Most PC hardware stores offer student discounts, Microsoft offer student discounts for their OS.

Again, buying an Apple hardware wise means you buy the screen or the form factor(or, for now, in some circumstances such as phones possibly, the battery), buying it software-wise is a matter of taste and buying it for any other reason can apply to PC hardware.

Read full topic

That’s the main reason google flagship > Samsung flagship etc[/quote]

item.title: Ipads Vs. Android Tablets
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:47, topic:524918”]Well, you haven’t spoken about the Ipad. Have you tried it? Take a view of both sides
But the android does have it’s good sides.
[size=1pt]Ehmm, can’t think of any at the moment >.>[/size][/quote]
I have not been able to get my hands on an iPad yet. I currently own an iPhone 3gs and bought my gf the iPod touch 4g. So I can’t put any views on the iPad unless I want a chance of being wrong. I’m currently trying to find one cheap on eBay or find a person willing to sell me an old gen1 or gen2. Until then I will stick to android being best. I will re-evaluate my opinion once I own an iPad.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipads Vs. Android Tablets
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:58, topic:524918”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=643612.msg4338398#msg4338398 date=1374750251]

If you’re going to get an android tablet, make sure the screen is of similar pixel density to the iPad.

The beauty of the Android OS, you can actually modify the screen density, I’ve had 1080p on my phone since 2010

what phone anyways?
IDK what you are talking about. the first 1080p smartphone came out in late 2012
if your phone had 1080p in 2010 its definitely not native 1080p
(tho i could be wrong)

Did you even read what I said? I said I modded the screen density not the native resolution.
[/quote]
What’s the point of that? To slow your phone down?
Make icons smaller? There is absolutely no point of 1080p if your screen isn’t[/quote]
Certainly doesn’t slow it down, yeah it’s a little bodgy but I like being able to display as much as possible on the screen at any time. So things like SMS applications will display about 12 message bubbles on the screen at one time instead of roughly 7, due to yes, smaller text size, smaller graphics, etc

Read full topic

item.title: Ipads Vs. Android Tablets
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:57, topic:524918”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=643612.msg4338708#msg4338708 date=1374785055]
You still forgot the screen, SD card reader, wireless chip, bluetooth chip, wireless keyboard, wireless mouse, webcam, mic, and operating system. It all mounts up and you end up paying a very similar amount. And if you’re a student you get a reduction along with phr33 AppleCare. But obviously if you don’t want any of that shit, or if you want to customise, or if you just hate mac then clearly PC build is the way to go.
[/quote]under the assumption that

-no need for a sd card
-you can torrent an os why buy it…
-already have a compatible wireless adapter
-this is 2013 you should already have other optical drives…
-same with keyboard, mic, mouse
-nobody going to cam with me unless they want to see a fat dude in the nude
-generally a pc builder already has a monitor just saying that or connect it to your tv
-no need for bluetooth usually speaking[/quote]

-agreed, pretty pointless but sometimes nice to have. not a big factor anyway so i shouldn’t have mentioned it
-unless you’re torrenting linux fack you. some people have to earn a living writing operating systems.
-good point I forgot the iMac had an optical drivve. you might have one, you might not. I certainly don’t feel like transferring optical drives between computers all the time just to save myself £50.
-same with keyboard and mouse. you might have one, you might not. I didn’t have a keyboard and mouse when I got my first desktop because I’d only ever owned a laptop.
-lolz
-again, you can’t just assume everybody already has half the shit they need to build a computer because they don’t. OH fudge A MOTHERBOARD EVERYBODY ALREADY HAS ONE OF THOSE. fudge THE HARD DISK THEY’RE DIRT CHEAP AND BUILDERS HAVE THEM LYING AROUND EVERYWHERE. ALSO SORRY WIFE TURN OFF THE TV NOW I HAVE COMPUTER STUFF TO DO.
-still a very useful feature to have, as you can use your wireless shit with it without having to worry about putting a dongle in every USB slot.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipads Vs. Android Tablets
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Lil_Smok3r:

Android tablets are screwed up. My sister bought one and once it’s full charge (it’s meant to last around 4 hours or something) but it finishes in like 40 minutes? The batteries in the Android tablets is completely… rubbish. Whereas an Ipad, has a better screen, easy control and a better battery.

What tablet was it? If it’s only supposed to last 4 hours then it sounds like an incredibly cheap one, if you want iPad performance out of an Android tablet, then buy an Android tablet priced around that of an iPad.

With a custom rom and kernel on my Nexus 7 I get 12~ hours of battery life with full brightness and hd video playback with wifi and shit running, 4 hours more than stock.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipads Vs. Android Tablets
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

First of all “android tablet” is such a large range of tablets. It depends so much on the specs of the tablet. Personally I have a TF101 with a custom android 4.2.2 Rom that’s pushing better than some new tegra3 tablets. The screen density means nothing in reality unless your wanting to spend large amounts, as long as your DPI is above 240 you won’t notice a large difference. Plus, if your not a stickler for a warranty adding a custom rom can double, possibly triple it’s performance. My tf101 stock benchmark was around 800 after a new rom I’ve hit we’ll over 3000. iPads are nice too, high dpi, better quality updates from the factory (even asus is known for bad updates for their tablets), much more eye candy. It really depends on what you want. I prefer android because its so open. A note, don’t compare battery life. Honestly too many people fail to realize there are many ways to make your battery last longer on android.

Read full topic
